data.title: 1690, Primary Resources in U.S. History and Literature, Toolbox Library, National Humanities Center
data.meta_description: Primary resources--historical documents, literary texts, and works of art--thematically organized with notes and discussion questions.
data.text:
All Recommended Texts

in chronological order by date of event or creation of map/image/object

For ease of use, modern capitalization style is used and English translations of non-English texts

are given for most publication titles, and ellipses are omitted from the end of shortened titles. No.

Date

Title

Online Source

1 ca. 1005 Norse account of meeting the Beothuk of "Vinland": Greenlander's Saga of the Flat-Island Book, publ. ca. 1387, excerpts

https://nationalhumanitiescenter.org/pds/amerbegin/contact/text4/text4read.htm National Humanities Center 2 ca. 1450 On the European slave trade in west Africa: Gomes Eannes de Azurara, The Chronicle of the Discovery and Conquest of Guinea, excerpts

https://nationalhumanitiescenter.org/pds/amerbegin/exploration/text7/text7read.htm National Humanities Center 3 1492-

1493 Christopher Columbus, Letter to the Treasurer of Aragon on his first voyage to the western hemisphere

https://www.bartleby.com/43/2.html Harvard Classics/

Bartleby.com 4 1493 On Columbus's first settlement on Hispaniola (Isabella): Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, General History of the Deeds of the Castilians on the Islands and Mainland of the Ocean Sea, publ. 1601-1615, excerpts
